candidates.title: Enable independent crate versioning for SDK crates
candidates.body:
## Motivation and Context
This enables SDK crates to version independently of each other so that a release only has to publish changed crates rather than every single crate even if it has no changes. This also enables multiple SDK releases per smithy-rs release since manual version bump is no longer required.

## Testing
- [x] Do a dry-run smithy-rs release with the changes and verify the artifacts
- [x] Do a dry-run SDK release with the changes and verify the artifacts

## Checklist
- [x] I have updated `CHANGELOG.next.toml` if I made changes to the AWS SDK, generated SDK code, or SDK runtime crates

By submitting this pull request, I confirm that you can use, modify, copy, and redistribute this contribution, under the terms of your choice.

candidates.title: `aws-config`: Fix compilation error with `rustls` and `native-tls` disabled
candidates.body:
The `ProviderConfig::with_tcp_connector` method uses
`aws_smithy_client::hyper_ext`, which only exists with the `client-hyper`
feature enabled. Add a feature enabling that, and enable it by default.

Introducing this feature does not cause breakage, because aws-config did not
previously compile with `default-features = false` and neither `rustls` nor
`native-tls` enabled.

## Testing

CI to make sure existing combinations of features don't fail; careful
inspection for the new feature. (Compiling the SDK overall without either
rustls or native-tls enabled is still a work in progress.)

## Checklist
- [x] I have updated `CHANGELOG.next.toml` if I made changes to the AWS SDK, generated SDK code, or SDK runtime crates

By submitting this pull request, I confirm that you can use, modify, copy, and redistribute this contribution, under the terms of your choice.

candidates.title: forbid timezone in rfc3339
candidates.body:
According to [0], "Date time as defined by the date-time production
in RFC3339 section 5.6 with no UTC offset..."

This commit makes the parsing compliant.

[0] https://awslabs.github.io/smithy/1.0/spec/core/protocol-traits.html#timestampformat-trait

Signed-off-by: Daniele Ahmed <ahmeddan@amazon.de>

## Motivation and Context
<!--- Why is this change required? What problem does it solve? -->
<!--- If it fixes an open issue, please link to the issue here -->

## Description
<!--- Describe your changes in detail -->

Comply with RFC3339 with no timezone offset. Format: https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc3339#section-5.6

## Testing

candidates.title: Feature: add support for aws-chunked content encoding
candidates.body:
## Motivation and Context
<!--- Why is this change required? What problem does it solve? -->
<!--- If it fixes an open issue, please link to the issue here -->
Supports the [flexible checksums](https://awslabs.github.io/smithy/1.0/spec/aws/aws-core.html#aws-protocols-httpchecksum-trait) feature. When sending streaming requests we need to include checksums as trailers and we need `aws-chunked` content encoding to do that.

## Description
<!--- Describe your changes in detail -->
This provides functionality specified in the [flexible checksums RFC](https://github.com/awslabs/smithy-rs/blob/main/design/src/rfcs/rfc0016_flexible_checksum_support.md)

## Testing
<!--- Please describe in detail how you tested your changes -->
<!--- Include details of your testing environment, and the tests you ran to -->
<!--- see how your change affects other areas of the code, etc. -->
I wrote a test

candidates.title: Decouple `aws-sdk-rust` release from `smithy-rs` release
candidates.body:
## Motivation and Context
This PR makes it possible to release smithy-rs separately from aws-sdk-rust, which allows for multiple SDK releases per code generator release so that we will be able to update SDK service models more frequently in the future without needlessly releasing smithy-rs.

I recommend reviewing each individual commit in the PR as that will make it easier to understand what's going on.

At a high level, this PR:
- Removes the concept of smoketest/full-sdk modes in `aws:sdk:assemble`. Now, instead, there is just a model path, and all the models from that path are used unless an explicit list is provided.
- Moves the changelog render tool out of `sdk-lints` and into its own independent tool. This new tool also has a `split` subcommand that is used to break SDK changelog entries away from smithy-rs changelog entries when a smithy-rs release is cut. The SDK release process then incorporates those split out entries the next time its code generator is updated. Entry duplication is avoided by tacking on a `since_commit` field for each SDK changelog entry when the logs are split.
- Refactors the tools to have one shared implementation for interacting with Git, where there used to be two different implementations.
- Adds a `release.yml` GitHub Action workflow that automatically releases smithy-rs upon workflow dispatch. This can be kicked off via GitHub CLI or through the website. It takes a `dry-run` input, which will produce release artifacts for inspection, but not cut the release and publish to crates.io if set.
- Updates `sdk-sync` to use models from aws-sdk-rust rather than from smithy-rs.

## Testing
- Ran dry run releases for both aws-sdk-rust and smithy-rs with these changes and verified the artifacts to be published looked correct
- Wrote the dry runs in such a way that they validate the secrets used so that when it comes time to do a real release, that aspect should be working
- Verified tool/build changes are backwards/forwards compatible enough that `sdk-sync` doesn't break when syncing older/newer commits. This resulted in some TODO comments that will be addressed in https://github.com/awslabs/smithy-rs/issues/1493

By submitting this pull request, I confirm that you can use, modify, copy, and redistribute this contribution, under the terms of your choice.

candidates.title: Add support for retrying individual call timeouts
candidates.body:
## Motivation and Context
- https://github.com/awslabs/aws-sdk-rust/issues/558

## Description
When timeout support was added initially, the resulting error `SdkError::TimeoutError` was never added to the retry policy which prevented these errors from being retried. This was a bug—This commit rectifies the and adds two integration-level tests that ensure that timeouts are properly retried.

## Testing
- [x] integration test

candidates.title: Export a usable Python implementation via shared library
candidates.body:
## Motivation and Context
https://github.com/awslabs/smithy-rs/issues/1367

## Description
This PR add several functionalities to the Python/Rust code-generation, making it usable for models that are not using Streaming and Union shapes.

* Export codegenerated shapes as shared library that can be imported by the Python interpreter.
* Add complete end-to-end testing running in CI.
* Register signals and handle workers processes lifecycle.
* Use a custom `SymbolProvider` to override non-primitive types that are exposed to Python.
* Implement support for `DateTime`.
* Cast Python exception into Rust error types.

## Testing
A Python service based on the Pokemon service is run during CI.

By submitting this pull request, I confirm that you can use, modify, copy, and redistribute this contribution, under the terms of your choice.

candidates.title: Pin the `clap` version used to prevent future deprecation warnings
candidates.body:
## Motivation and Context
The `clap` maintainers are planning to introduce more deprecations with every minor release (https://github.com/clap-rs/clap/issues/3822):
>  We do expect to be adding deprecations every minor release and we recommend not blocking CI on this as the toil adds backpressure on crates to not evolve their API.

Since we're disallowing warnings broadly at the environment variable level, this PR pins all the `clap` versions so that future minor releases won't break our CI.

By submitting this pull request, I confirm that you can use, modify, copy, and redistribute this contribution, under the terms of your choice.

candidates.title: Reintroduce `sdk-sync` parallelism by disabling Smithy parallelism
candidates.body:
## Motivation and Context
This reverts #1436 and configures the JVM so that Smithy codegen won't project services in parallel, and introduces a CLI arg to override the number of threads used.

candidates.title: remove parallelism from the sync tool
candidates.body:
## Motivation and Context
- the build job frequently OOMs

## Description

smithy-build actually utilizes `ForkJoinPool.common()` when executing build projections. Because each service is its own projection, the build internally is _already_ running in parallel. Because of this, running the sync in parallel produces uneccessary memory pressure.

This change:
- removes parallelism
- runs gradle `--no-daemon --info` for better log output


## Testing
- e2e test in sync tool


By submitting this pull request, I confirm that you can use, modify, copy, and redistribute this contribution, under the terms of your choice.

candidates.title: Implement release-aware yank tooling
candidates.body:
## Motivation and Context
This is a prerequisite for partial releases and releases with unsynchronized version numbers. Once we start doing those, the new `[release]` section of `versions.toml` (introduced in #1400) will need to be used to yank a release. This PR reworks the existing yank tool to take a release tag or `versions.toml` file path to yank a release rather than the old crate category and repository approach.

By submitting this pull request, I confirm that you can use, modify, copy, and redistribute this contribution, under the terms of your choice.

candidates.title: Add release metadata to `versions.toml`
candidates.body:
## Motivation and Context
As we start unsynchronizing SDK crate version numbers, we will need to know exactly which crates went out with a given release so that if we need to yank that release, it will actually be possible. This PR revises SDK generation via the `sdk-sync` tool to feed information from the previous release's `versions.toml` into the creation of the next release's `versions.toml` so that this information of which crates actually changed can be retained.

The publisher tool was also modified to read an expected tag from the `versions.toml` file rather than expecting the `aws-config` version number. This will be required also since `aws-config`'s version number won't match the release tag in the future when versions aren't synchronized.

By submitting this pull request, I confirm that you can use, modify, copy, and redistribute this contribution, under the terms of your choice.
